alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 10 at 3:41AM PST until March 12 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Eastern San Gabriel Mountains, Interstate 5 Corridor, Northern Ventura County Mountains, Southern Ventura County Mountains and Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A slow moving Atmospheric River storm system will result in many hours of steady moderate rain. Rainfall totals of 1 to 3 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. This rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor
